questions.question: Micro-organisms in the soil are important for soil health. Their main role in soil health is:

choices.answer: Limiting production yields by improving sustainability
Indirectly contribute to the biological fertility of soil
Supporting nutrient cycles that are fundamentally important to life on the
Decompose organic matter entering the soil and generate warmth

questions.question: A farm grows pasture which sheep graze on. When the sheep are at a marketable size they are sold. This is an...
A farm which is growing lucerne to make hay.

choices.answer: An intensive plant and animal production enterprise

choices.answer: They do not have a duodenum.
They eat a very different diet than other ruminants.
They have five stomach compartments instead of the usual four.

questions.question: Being environmentally conscientious, reducing inputs, supporting ecosystems and creating supporting infrastructure

choices.answer: It has a very high pH that assists in the breakdown of fibrous material.

questions.question: Nitrogen Deficiency

choices.answer: Poor growth. Pale green or yellow leaves
Curling of leaf tips. Yellowing. Purple spots.
Stunting of growth. Purpling and yellowing of older leaves.

questions.question: Phosphorus Deficiency

choices.answer: Poor growth. Pale green or yellow leaves
Brown scorching. Curling of leaf tips. Yellowing. Purple spots.
Stunting of growth. Purpling and yellowing of older leaves.
Green leaves. Curling of leaf tips.

questions.question: Potassium Deficiency

choices.answer: Poor growth. Pale green or yellow leaves
Brown scorching. Curling of leaf tips. Yellowing. Purple spots.
Stunting of growth. Purpling and yellowing of older leaves.
Green leaves. Curling of leaf tips.

questions.question: What is a major difference between the digestive system of a monogastric animal and that of a ruminant animal?

choices.answer: Mon - many stomach compartments. Rum - one stomach
Rum - enzymes and acid in stomach. Mono - Microbes in stomach
Rum - many stomach compartments. Mono - one stomach
Rum - only sheep and cows. Mono -  Humans and other animals

have a more efficient feed conversion ratio
eat small amounts of a wide variety of plants
